DataElement.preferredName: Patient Contraindicated Agent Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the administration of a particular agent, an active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect, being unsuitable and inadvisable, often because of a likely adverse reaction, as a medical and/or social characteristic prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of a particular agent, an active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect, being unsuitable and inadvisable, often because of a likely adverse reaction, as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: To indicate the inadvisability of (a medical treatment, for example). (Dictionary.com):An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: State of a particular method of treatment, regimen, procedure, medication, etc. of being unsuitable and inadvisable, often because of a likely adverse reaction.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Currently receiving treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Currently receiving treatment with any agents that are contraindicated by study therapies: A) IMC-A12 - none identified to date B) Lapatinib - CYP3A4 inhibitors and inducers (see Appendix IV) including grapefruit and grapefruit juice

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Receiving CYP3A4 inhibitors and inducers or any other contraindicated agent listed in Appendix III

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does participant have contraindication to cisplatin chemotherapy including no clinically significant hearing loss unless willing to accept the potential of further loss of hearing, no symptomatic peripheral neuropathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of any contraindications to oxybutynin?
